text.quote: Clifftop chapel featuring a quaint, open-air sanctuary, towering crosses & sweeping bay views.
google: This chapel is breathtakingly beautiful. There isn't anything too complex about the architecture. It's simple yet stunning. The English translation is "Chapel of Peace" and it truly gives you a sense on peace as you sit inside the chapel. …

This is defiantly a must see! 
It’s such a beautiful landmark!
The view of the ocean and all Acapulco is stunning!
Beautiful in its simplicity and open-air structure, this inspiring non-denominational chapel commands an unparalleled view of the bay.
trip: Carlos Alergria shared this gem to our family. And let me say, it was beautiful! Incredible views and Carlos is a talented photographer as well as our favorite Driver!

This was a beautiful chapel in a gated neighborhood. I think you have to go with a tour group to gain entrance. It sits high above the city so it offered scenic panoramic views of Acapulco. The story of the family that built this chapel is intriguing. If visiting, I would plan

A lovely spot and the history is very interesting. This was constructed as a family chapel and one sibling still lives here. The chapel itself is non-denominational so all are welcome to visit and to pray. Worth a visit.

The cross and adjacent “temple” was built in honor of a wealthy woman’s two sons that died in a plane crash in Mexico. It was not meant to be specifically for any one religion. You’ll have nice views from up there and also pass through a couple of checkpoints. It’s nothing
Our guide said this is the 4th best view in the world, and I see why. It is spectacular! It is worth the short drive from town. Very peaceful and many beautiful places for photos.
Stunning flowers & view. Very moving memorial to the children of the family that built the entire site. the story told to us by our guide was a real tear jerker.
Beautiful contemporary chapel, "hand" sculpture and great views of Acapulco Bay. The surrounding neighbourhood is very upscale.
Interesting history and great view in multiple directions. Worth stopping at if passing by. Donation appreciated.
A nice visit, the view at the top is something to see (at least once.) Prepare to walk on hills and steps.

It is free entrance to visit this chapel which is perched 1250 feet above sea level in a great setting overlooking the harbour. An impressive feature of the chapel is its towering huge 12 foot cross. The panoramic views of the bay are amazing.It is worth the trek just for the
Amazing place. Incredible views, would make a beautiful place to get married. The architecture is so cool and acoustics are unbelievable inside the church.
Wonderful, spiritual experience. Great views of Acapulco. Start your tour here. We loved it. Great place for a wedding or renewing your vows.
The view from here is truly breath taking! It is very quiet and peaceful here. Nice spot to take photos too. We visited on a tour with Carlos Alegria - Acapulco Tours & Taxis.
Lovely church on top of the hill, a must visit place in Acapulco. The views are amazing, we loved our visit so much

This was an amazing place to visit. It has beautiful pictures view at the top of the hill. The cross is nice as well. The tomb where the brother, mom and father that owns the land was so wholesome and spiritual. Such a peacefulness and secluded area.

I don't think I can begin to describe how beautiful this place is. our tour guide gave us the history of the how and why it was created and we were so moved behind the history and story. This is a must see if you visit Acapulco

Highly recommend the visit. Beautiful view atop of the hill. Minimalist architecture and excellent use of the space and great surroundings.The walk from Las Brisas Hotel is challenging, but well worth it.
Peaceful and bittersweet. Love seeing the light filter through the stone wall behind the altar. The sculpture of the two right hands was very poignant.

Introduced a travel companion to the Chapel of Peace. This non- denominational religious chapel has historically memorable story behind the creation. Great view of the Acapulco bay. Don’t overlook this travel site.

Take a cab and go, no need to find a tour, the cab will wait for you and it’s only a 20 min or so drive from wherever you are at. You will also be there about 30 min or so, just ask the driver how much and they will even take the best pictures for you since they do this all the

Truly stunning views and an amazing story on how it came into being. Our tour guide, Carlos Alegria from Quinto Sol Tour (omatacapulco@gmail.com) shared all his knowledge and took some amazing pictures.
The cross stands tall and is easily seen on the top of the mountain. This is a memorial by a family that lost two sons in an air accident. Very weill done and you will enjoy the views.

The chapel is set on top of a mountain with beautiful views. It is a peaceful quiet place for reflection. A giant cross towers in the sky. The grounds are impeccable. There is no fee for access just a donation requested.
Wander full arquitecture Precious Gardens Views of Acapulco bay fantastic You can attend to Catholic service on Saturday and Sunday t

This beautiful chapel provides an incredible view of Acapulco Bay. This location includes a small gift shop, bathrooms, multiple levels to take pictures, and the church with seating space. Note a few important things: 1. You must go through security when you enter Las Brisas.

The Chapel is breathtaking! It has the white cross on top of the hill that can be seen from any place in Acapulco, gardens, mausoleum underneath the chapel, a small gift shop, the holding hands of peace and the spectacular view of Acapulco Bay. The history of the chapel is sad

When you arrive at the Chapel of Peace, you have a feeling of an other world experience. When they say peace, they mean just that. Along with the beautiful views, you feel a very welcoming atmosphere. I don't care how young or old you are, you have to visit this area.
I felt the peace that this place has to offer. We had a tour guide who took us around here and he explained the history. Very peaceful!

This chapel is absolutely gorgeous. The story behind it is so special. The views of Acapulco are breathtaking from the church bi highly recommend visiting. You will not be disappointed! Call Sebastian Hernandez at ACAPULCO FOR ALL for the guided tour!!
We loved learning the history of this beautiful chapel and enjoyed every minute of our visit here. There are beautiful photo opportunities and such a feeling of peace here.

The final resting place of the family of Carlos Trouyet. Carlos was a Mexican entrepreneur and financier, best known for assembling the group of investors who bought TeleMex from Ericsson and ITT under threat of nationalization. One of his developments was the Las Brisas
Perched on a mountain top in Las Brisas. Beautiful chapel. Be sure to attend mass at 10:00am. Great views for taking pictures and taking in the beautiful gardens.
Was the most beautiful, peaceful, humbling place I have ever been. Its a must see for anyone while in Acapulco
Beautiful chapel with lovely view. Simple and pretty with cross which can be viewed from a great distance.
A must to see in Acapulco. Will see whole bay and all of Acapulco. Chapel has great lighting and very quite place. Is a non denominational chapel.

The history behind this Chapel is extremely interesting. We had the pleasure of visiting this Chapel and learning all about its history, meaning and importance. The Chapel was constructed with the idea of "being simple," which can be seen through the careful placement of

As we arrived, Ave Maria was playing, and it felt heavenly (there was a wedding taking place). This chapel is located inside a gated community, and it closes to visitors at 6:00 pm. They will ask you for identification at the entrance, and hold it until you leave. The chapel is
An excellent view of Acapulco which many people don’t get to. The chapel was a very interesting place.

we had a privately organized tour of this place through our hotel. We could see the cross from our hotel on Acapulco Bay, and I expected it to be a cross for a church. The guide told us the sad story of the cross, and why it is there, why it is so large. The church and grounds
Such a beautiful, fabulous little church built above a memorial and with a lovely cross and statue of loosely clasped hands
We love this site; it’s just beautiful! We visit every time we are in Acapulco! The history is just so amazing. Visit!!!

Truly one of the best views in Acapulco. But don't just go there for that: the history of the place is quite interesting. It's a very peaceful place for meditation or prayer, but definitely something you don't want to miss while you're touring around the beautiful city.

we did this excersion and loved it, the churc was very nice and the story behind it was even more beautiful but the best was when we left the church we went out through the back and WOW...the city of Acapulco was there for the view, was absolute beautiful and everyone in our
Capilla de la Paz is open daily for tourists. We did not attend a worship center there; just visited to see the architecture and the view. Bring pesos with you if you wish to use their bathrooms!
We went here on a city tour. It is a very tranquil spot. A nice quiet and calm spot away from the bustle of the city.
High on hill with gorgeous views of Acapulco. Beautiful architecture. Peaceful interesting family history.
Well worth the hike up the steep hill . See Acapulco from above the Bay and FYI Elvis didn’t film ‘fun in Acapulco’ here
Very nice place to visit. Better to have good tour guide to show you around. They don’t have many sign to show the place.

I visited the Chapel of peace many years before.You get to see a beautiful view of Acapulco. The property is well manicured.This time they were doing maintenance work to the cross it had a scaffle hanging from it so my photos wasant so impressive so I was a little disappointed
Very good place for thé view of the bahia of Acapulco and very quiet place peacefull and a good breaze
Drive up was scenic. Church itself was so calming and relaxing. Built into the rocks, decor was perfect

We hired a personal guide (Roberto Estrada 744-121-3471) to take us around and he brought us to the Chapel. Spoke english and was able to give us history. View was magnificent. Great for picture taking.

The view from the chapel is incredible -- worth the trip, by all means. In fact, In would say it is a must-see in Acapulco, alongside the cliff divers. When we visited, we saw no guides provided by the site itself. Instead, our driver, Sebastian of Acapulco for All, served as
Our guide took us to the top of this hill to show us this magnificent chapel hill by a Mexican family. The story behind the chapel is quite remarkable and location is wonderful.
Very interesting and beautiful place to see! Beautiful views and interesting part of history in Acapulco.
We had the opportunity to visit this place and hear the history of why it was built. There were a recently married couple there taking photos. This is a great place to take pictures and Acapulco.
This Ecumenical chapel is an amazing tribute to a family tragedy, and a peaceful place for contemplation; get there early for a decent place to park--opens at 10AM
Beautiful chapel with a great history!we truly enjoyed seeing its beauty as well as hearing about the history of it and meaning of it .Stunning views from the top of this maintain

According to our Acapulco’s tour schedule, the chapel was the first leg. The aim of the people of all faiths is to find peace. Our eyes were rewarded with a peaceful décor and a breathtaking view of Acapulco and surroundings. The iconic sculpture “Las Manos de la Hermandad”
A very nice small church, beautifully appointed with old wood and marble. Very nice to see and a great view of Acapulco bay.
We visited this spot during our Sightseeing tour and it was well worth it. The breathtaking views of Acapulco Bay were the best part of our vacation. It's very peaceful here. Didn't wanna leave!
Highest point in Acapulco & it offers an amazing view of Acapulco Bay--definitely a must-see when you visit Acapulco!

There is a few different ways to see and visit historical sites in Acapulco. You can go on the tours provided by your travel group or you can find a private driver that will take you to all the histortial places and into local areas like we did. We used an English speaking guide
Enjoyed visiting this chapel very much. Our tour guide gave us the history of the family and showed us where they are buried on-site. We also took great photos of Acapulco from the hilltop.

This place is amazing. We've been here a few times and always love going back. The views of the bay are amazing and the chapel and cross itself are as incredible as the stories behind them. This is a must do.

It was built arround the 1950-1960. beautifull place at the top of a mountain, in one of the most luxury an famous part of acapulco. The view is supperb, the feeling ins nice. We went to have a catholic ceremony, and we stay one hour more just to be there.
The Chapel is an amazing and well designed. It's peaceful inside to take time to reflect. The view outside was absolutely stunning.

This spiritual and awe-inspiring location offers the best views of Acapulco in the city. A revered and respected chapel with unique architecture is worth the trip up the mountain. A feeling of calm and quiet surround this serene location and respect is essential. The praying

Beautiful Interesting story to share Carlos our taxi driver brought us here on our city tour and we really enjoyed this place. Please call Carlos if you need a personal guide or driver. He speaks English and is a great connection. Call him to arrange pick up and tour guide
great place to visit, great history and very easy to get to. Although a lot of climbing. Also a very relaxing place to get out of the sun and heat
The views are hard to beat. The chapel itself is interesting for its mid-century architecture and there is a very peaceful, contemplative quality to the place.
Absolutely stunning views and everything was so peaceful on that mountain. This was part of our city tour.
Highly recommended. The best view in Acapulco. There is a gift shop there as well. You'll have to climb up some steep hills so be prepared to do some walking.
parents were married here & family friends live just below where i spent slot of time -bonita .. what an incredible view con lots a memories . unforgettable !
High on the mountain overlooking Acapulco, this is a simple modern chapel that allows the incredible setting and views to shine. A quiet peaceful spot and stunning views, a must visit.
It is a very good visit if one enjoys seeing modern church design. Great layout. Well done architecture with clean lines enhancing the location and the great views from it.
it was interesting to hear the story behind the creation of the building and to see no pictures or other religious items

If you’re in Acapulco I recommend taking the time to go up here. We had walked to the Walmart from our place at The Emporium hotel (about 25 mins). Could see that the big cross on the hill wasn’t thaaaat far away, so thought we’d go. Across the road from the Walmart was a
Great views and scenery, very well designed piece of architecture and church. We saw the inside and outside.
This haven of tranquility is an excellent piece of architecture. The views over Acapulco are stunning.
Out of a family tragedy comes this lovely, quiet place with staggering views over Acapulco. Well worth the effort.

Lovely quiet place and extraordinary view. Mass on Sunday was beautiful. This memorial is a must see - simple and profound.

this is the most famous church in Acapulco standing right on top of hill.Being there you going to feel insouciance....it's so tranquilize and picturesque like a fairyland. One must see to believe it.

We took a taxi up to the chapel and spent about 40 minutes admiring the beautiful view of Acapulco. Very tranquil and serene place. Highly recommend whilst in Acapulco.

A beautiful church with amazing views. They maintain the grounds through donations, so be sure and give if you visit.

Wonderful place to visit. Very peaceful. If one goes to Acapulco, must try to see the Chapel of Peace.

Wow, what an inspiring, and inspirational place to come and see when in Acapulco. If you have a chance of seeing when on a tour - be sure to come and experience.

a beautiful old building in daily use (we saw a wedding) at the center of town. You could sense the serenity and peace as you watched worshipers and examined the artwork and statues which adorn the church.

Happened to be touring here on a Sunday morning. They were having a service. Neat to be there during this & here the music, etc. Beautiful views.

Fantastic view! Recommended you go with a bus tour or tour guide to get the history of the place. The shop has some lovely items for sale and the use of toilet costs $5 (pesos) which is a great donation.

This Church is at the top of the hill in ACAPULCO the view is amazing. Built by a banker's daughters the parents were killed in an airplane accident when they were younger

Well worth the visit! We had beautiful weather and the ride up to the chapel was interesting as well!

Amazing view of Acapulco you can see all the surrounding of the city. The history of how the chapel was build and the scenery very nice. It's amazing how the tree roots are flat against the walls... We had a great tour guide Sabastin Hernandez that knew the history very well

The story behind this chapel is so kind hearted. The views are spectacular! Roberto Alarcón is amazing tour guide!
We went on a City Tour with Sebastian, website, acapulcoforall.com. He showed us the wonderful view and gave us all the background about the family. This tour is the highest point in Acapulco.

Wonderful design, beautiful church. Go with Roberto tour guide, he will give you the history and take pictures for you.

The Chapel of Peace is a fantastic spot to get a great view of the city of Acapulco and the gorgeous bay.. Highly recommend.
Beautiful area church with interesting history and views of old Acapulco. There was a very good singer. Very peaceful.
The story behind the chapel was amazing. The entire grounds are so peaceful and the views of the bay are spectacular. We were very humbled to be there and so glad we visited.
Great views & serene.me and my wife took some great pictures there. Be sure to leave a donation at the end of your visit there, it is well worth the price of admission
taxi takes you to this peaceful, lovely sanctuary. Interesting story about how & why this place was built.

This chapel is pure genius architecture. So peaceful and restoring. The tragic story of the family behind the creation of this chapel is compelling. You will have to visit to learn why.

Salvador was our drive/guide and he did a great job driving us around and telling us all the history.

This was a wonderful part of our city tour! Lots of history and fantastic views of Acapulco. Using sebastian at Acapulco for all was a great idea as he is very knowledgeable and made it come alive for us.

Beautiful architecture and setting, great history about the origins of the chapel. Well maintained and beautiful view of Acapulco bay.

The Capilla is on top of a hill over looking a beautiful view of Acapulo. My guide David Alcaraz (davidalcaraz822@gmail,com) explained all about why The Chapel was built and about the surrounding neighborhood

Gorgeous chapel with the most amazing view we've ever seen! We were literally taken aback when we got to the top.
Great to see the church and the view was breathtaking. Good picture of the sea. It was inspiring to see the church and also free to visit.
An extraordinary experience on top of the mountain. Wonderful views, and grand architecture. The story of how this chapel came to be is inspiring.
The tribute to his two sons is just breath taking. Be sure an experience it. The views are beautiful and the chapel simple and elegant. I wish we could have gone to Sunday Mass there.
Built by their parents for the suddenly 2 sons deaths this chapel is wonderful. The view of the bay is amazing.
this is definitely a place to visit while in Acapulco! one of the main highlights in the city I have been there many times.
this is a very beautiful place to visit and the view is amazing the story about this place is very good.the road is steep but passable

A beautiful spot in Acapulco! Built by a family for celebrations of any faith or religion. It is a special place with amazing views of Acapulco. We visited here on our Acapulco City Tour with tour guide, Roberto Alarcon whom we highly recommend!
We are not religious people but this was GREAT site. The views and art sculptures were amazing and worth trip. There are no cost, a donation was suggested..
This precious chapel is worth the trip. It's very peaceful and the views are priceless. We enjoyed hearing the story of its history.
The views and the structures are nothing less than incredible. definitely a sight to see. Such a beautiful location.

Interesting drive up through the "high rent district" and the Cross is much taller than can be imagined from afar... The view of the whole of Acapulco Bay is without a doubt spectacular.. The history behind the monument and the architecture is worth the visit...

Went here with family on a private day tour from a cruise ship. The chapel was very quiet, serene and has a sad story about why it was built. The views from the chapel over Acapulco were amazing and it is worth going here for pictures.The toilets at the chapel were really dirty/
Very beautiful and full of history. It has a wonderful view of the bay and Acapulco. The story of why it was built and the family was interesting and sad.

We visited this place whilst on our tour with Roger Dodger of Rudy's Tours (an excellent tour company). A very touching and interesting modern story of love and devotion goes along with chapel and coupled with an excellent view it makes for a touching visit.

The death of two sons brings about an Acapulco memorial. The Chapel built by a family to honor a pledge to God is now maintained by the city of Acapulco. For a fee, many are enshrined there. Great views and a very lovely place. Church services are held there each Sunday

Beginning with the truly sad story of the wife in a wealthy family of Acapulco, who owned the entire mountain retreat where the Chapel de la Paz was eventually built to make it easier for her to go to Church, which she reportedly did daily. The death of her two boys..wow.

A beautiful setting and view of the city and bay. A spectacular chapel built by a private person for his wife and later donated to the public as a non denominational chapel where services are still held.
This area gives you the best views of Acapulco. Very nice place to have a wedding. It was nice to tour this place..

Despite the cross, this is not a purely Christian experience - but I think it is deeply spiritual. The chapel exudes such a wonderful aura of peace and tranquillity coupled with the most exquisite views of Acapulco that we had difficulty tearing ourselves away.
Definitely worth the drive or the taxi ride to get here. The best views of Acapulco anywhere around. And very quiet cool and peaceful a nice place to spend 30 to 45 minutes taking in the views.

The chapel is worth visiting for its stark architecture. The gated community in which it is sited has beautiful homes. For me, however, the most worthwhile aspect of my visit was the view of Acapulco from the hill on which the chapel is built. Strongly recommended.
My family recently visited Capilla de la Paz and discovered a wonderful family story. Its a good visit for the family or for couples.
Visited as part of Roberto Alarcon's tour. Great story behind the chapel. The view is tremendous, and the drive to get there is also very scenic.

This is up a hill, in the middle of a very nice, gated community with beautiful houses. The chapel itself is very pretty, but the main reason to go there is the best view of the town from up there. Only two problems is it is closed at night, when I guess the view is even nicer,

The Chapel of Peace was part of our day tour with Sebastian Hernandez Ricardo, and it didn't disappoint. The property is very well maintained. The story behind the architect and building of the structure is incredible. The cross can be seen from most places in Acapulco,

This is an interesting place to visit high up on the mountain overlooking Acapulco Bay. Make sure to get them to tell you the history of how it was built and visit under the church. Great views of the Bay.
Great story behind this chapel, beautiful view. Not enough toilets too long to wait. Very scenic peaceful, wouldn't be great for people with challenged mobility

We stopped here on a private tour! Lots of Photo Ops of and around the chapel. Lots of History and an amazing view! The grounds were well maintained! It was an easy walk for us but there was a bit of a hill and steps.
The grounds were beautiful as were the views. Our tour guide, Roberto gave us a wonderful and informative tour. There was a photo shoot for a Quinceiera happening.

Went here with Roberto Alarcon Tours. Already did a review of this man and his great service. Wanted to add a few photos.
Not to be missed, the story and architecture of this Chapel and the awesome views overlooking Acapulco Bay.
An amazing place with a fabulous view.A young lady was posing for some quincera and allowed us to take photos of her.

Another must see in Acapulco. Hire a local guide to take you on a tour of the city and see the chapel of peace. We used Jose Luciano Gonzalez for an afternoon tour and it was great. Jose was very knowledgeable, spoke very good English. We enjoyed Jose as a tour guide so much
Interesting place, loved the views of the bay and the ocean. The story of why it exists is touching.
Beautiful views & gorgeous church! I highly recommend taking the hike all the way to the top so you can see some of the amazing mansions on the way up and take epic pictures of the 360 views!
A nice visit which does not take more than 20 mins. Has the best views of the bay of Acapulco as well as the open ocean. The chappel itself is very nice and exotic.
Most peaceful location, Best view of old Acapulco. Donation for upkeep recommended. Great picture location.

Each time I came to Acapulco, I went here. The story behind this "chapel" about the family who built it is very interesting. The view of the bay is great from here and a nice drive up the hill with amazing houses to see on the way. It's not your average religious site to visit

If you're interested in churches, then this is a nice chapel for you to visit. I personally felt that it was a personal kind of church and not much to talk about. The history is very interesting, and the view is awesome. If you have the time and you're in the area, you really
The tour I went on was solo and the history of the Church is very worth while. Two brothers who planned most of Acapulco died in Plane crash in 1967 and the family erected the church in their memory

My husband and I went to this chapel as part of a city tour of Acapulco. The story of how this chapel and large cross was built was amazing and a little sad. I don't want to retell the whole story, but it is amazing how Carlos Trouyet built these structures as a memorial to
Get a tour package to see this. The history of the chapel is very interesting. You drive up a very nice area of the City.

Beautiful hilltop chapel. Very peaceful place with wonderful views of Acapulco. Our guide Sergio Molina shared the interesting history of the family who built it. We were able to visit even though church was going on at the time. Definitely worth the trip!!
Chapel has a beautiful architecture. The view of Acapulco Bay from behind the chapel is simply breathtaking.
Lovely chapel that has some interesting history. Private residence given back to city. Originally Catholic church, converted to non denominational. Be prepared for lots of steps and uneven terrain.

We took a trip up the hill and enjoyed Sunday mass last week. Event though we don't speak Spanish and are not regular church goers it was a lovely experience. The guitar and hymns were upbeat and musical not sombre as I'm used to. Everyone was singing and there a point during

This is a magnificent attraction and a must see! The view of Acapulco bay is amazing! The chapel is a simple but wonderful construction. The opaque triangular onyx tiles are spectacular. The wood work inside is wonderful. The huge cross and the bronze sculpture of the hands are
We loved the view from the Chapel. Loved the story the a father built the chapel in honor of his two sons who were killed in a car accident and the statue of two hands is in honor of them.
It was as peaceful as it sounds and so much different than the usual chapel in Mexico, very modern, very quiet and had a 360 view of the bay
The chapel is on a mountain overlooking Acapulco bay. The view is breathtaking. We attended a family wedding here and found it to be a perfect spot for this kind of event.

A very peaceful place. The views are breathtaking, and a 30 minutes walk around will make you feel good with yourself for choosing this visit. The houses around are VERY expensive, and supposedly famous narcos lived, and still live, near by.
Interesting story of the Chapel and the family. The view is wonderful! It gives you a perspective of the area
We love this church with so great view in Acapulco. It interesting just for the location, we also enjoy the mass, althought it could get very hot inside.
Beautiful church and the architecture is awesome. Something great to see. I enjoyed it very much and would recommemd stopping by.
Such a peaceful and beautiful church. We walked around the ground and the view was beautiful. The history of th church is interesting.
Stopped here on our day trip in Acapulco. It's a beautiful spot to visit and learn more about. Great pics from this incredibly high vista as well!

This is the perfect place to visit early in the morning, at the time that there is no one in site. It is the perfect place to sit back, take a deep breath and relax and meditate. The views of the bay from up above are phenomenal. This is a must see in Acapulco
We loved this visit. The view is incredible and the history of the location is mesmerizing. The chapel itself has a great sense of peace about it that you can really feel when you walk in!

If you want to get the best view of the Acapulco bay, come to the Capilla de la Paz. It is a great place to meditate, get some moments of peace and also a great opportunity to take one of the best pictures of Acapulco bay.
The Chapel of peace was built by a family that ended up having a lot of personal loss from the wife the 2 boys and then the husband soon after completion. The family still runs the attraction today.

There were no other visitors the day we went, so it truly was a chapel of peace. It was great to get an up-close view of the cross that is visible from so many locations around Acapulco. I sang in the Chapel, and the acoustics were excellent.

Las Brisas sits on the side of a mountain over looking the Acapulco Bay at first you are ah! struck at the beauty of the surrounding. The beautiful blue bay, The majestic mountains, and the world famous Acapulco strip. The hotel may be one of the oldest but it is very well

The visit to this Chapel of peace was a very touching experience. To learn the history of how the cross came to be is so inspiring. You'll enjoy be part of such an enriching experience. The view from the site of the cross is absolutely breathtaking. Be sure to visit.
This was a highlite of our trip. The guide, Sebastian Hernandez wes so informative. He was so much a part of our trip and enjoyment. Thanks Sebastian!!!

This peaceful place is a must for people visiting Acapulco. If you want to go away from the caotic world outside and in, this place will help you do so. Also the information of the family that built it is interesting. I recommend this beautiful place.
Wonderful place, fascinating history, I was amaxed by the dedicatin of one family to build chruches acorss mexico. Great explanation from our guide Roberto robertoalarcontours.com

Our guide stopped by here on our tour of Acapulco. Learning about the family that built it and the story behind it was interesting. The cross is approx. 147 feet tall, and can be seen for miles. We flew directly over the top of it on the way back to Mexico City as well. There

The Capilla de la Paz is a must see. The giant cross on the top of the Las Brisas mountainside can be viewed from almost anywhere in Acapulco, but it's even better at the Chapel of Peace looking down over all of Acapulco Bay.
Very interesting tour of chapel and grounds and best view of Acapulco Bay. Great place to get some good pictures as well.

This chapel is located atop one of the hills that encircle Acapulco Bay. The chapel is very peaceful with beautiful gardens and breathtaking scenery in all directions. It is a little daunting with stairs but worth the effort. Make sure you bring your camera and a small donation

Visited as part of the city tour provided by Sebastian Hernandez. Beautiful escape in a natural setting and Sebastian was able to give the history behind the location which really contributed to the value of the visit. I can see why this location would be a draw for special
Amazing views, glad we took the time to hear the history behind this church. Las Brisas is a beautiful gated community it is located in.
Been here a thousand times and still enjoy the views and tranquility up there. I highly recommend this place.
Las manos de la Hermanidad statute was very inspiring for me since a few months before my visit I lost two brothers in the same circomptances

The place is quite far from our hotel, but it was worth the trip. The chapel's design was beautiful and the acoustic inside is fantastic. The place is rather peaceful and the views are indeed breathtaking. There is no cost to visit the place, however they suggest a

This ecumenical chapel is a true center of peace. I spent about an hour here on a Friday morning and could have actually stayed longer. Very serene and it has spectacular views. A great place to start a guided tour of Acapulco. I went with Arturo Ramirez Rivera, owner of Aca
We made a visit here and we were humbled by the experience. Simply beautiful! The grounds and view from here are breathtaking. We saw the cross from our plane as we approached for landing.

The cross is visible from all of Acapulco Bay, it stands to reason you have a view of the whole bay from the chapel at the foot of the cross. It's a non-sectarian modern chapel, built by devoted parents as a memorial to their sons who died in a plane crash.
The chapel was beautiful. The views of Acapulco were great. The Hands of the Brotherhood and story behind them and the chapel were very inspiring.
Beautiful chapel made in part from local onyx. Breathtaking views of Acapulco from up high. Well worth the visit. A must see in Acapulco.
Views from and of the chapel grounds were beautiful. The chapel itself was lovely and welcoming. It was a short visit, but I'm glad we took the time to see it.

Our tour guide brought us here and I must say that I'm glad he did. He also took the time to tell us about the fascinating history of the church and showed us around. There were beautiful views of the bay, an amazing and extremely tall cross that when standing next to it was
We took a private tour. Asked the driver for us to stop at this chapel. The view of the Bay was simply breathtaking! Very clean and well maintained grounds. Was happy we stopped by.
A gorgeous non-denominational chapel high in the hills. The grounds were full of beautiful plants and trees (watch out for the mangos) and the chapel itself was so unexpectedly calm and gorgeous.
Interesting history of the family that had the Chael built. Beautiful scenery and sculptures as well as a peaceful chapel in which to give thanks.
My husband and I really enjoyed the view from the chapel. Our guide told us the story behind it being built.
Very nice with a great back story. Built a as tribute to has two sons that died in what was described as the "accident"
This is a beautiful spot to see, the history is sad but the grounds are spectacular and what an honor to share the beauty from tragedy. The choicest piece of property in all of Acapulco.
Panoramic views of the city and bay. Most interesting were the large homes surrounding the church, some owned by famous Hollywood types.
Amazing story behind the Chapel, beautiful view of the city. Very peaceful place to be at and the houses around a just breathtaking and expensive.....

Although our cab driver thought we would be astounded by this chapel, we found it to be rather cool for it's location but otherwise not too amazing. Oh yeah, we drove up a really steep and winding residential street to get there.
Excellent view of city. Would certainly recommend visiting the Chapel to first-time visitors of Acapulco.

This was the first place we visited after arriving. It was so beautiful and peaceful with an awesome view overlooking the ocean. Our tour guide Ricardo Alvarez was very knowledgeable and gave a lot of history.
We could see the church just up the hill from our hotel, it was lovely to visit it and see how the architect incorporated natural elements into the church and the grounds.

What a wonderful, serene environment that family has provided for the public. Taking a moment in the chapel and then experiencing the beautiful views really allows you to take a moment during your trip to reflect on all that is good.
Went here with our tour guide Roberto Alarcon. Such a peaceful spot and a great story of how it came to be.
It's a wonderful chapel, with spectacular views. This is a definite stop to include in your Acapulco plans!
Part of the 1-day inclusive tour. (thanks Roberto Alarcon). Great backstory, beautiful views. Exciting drive up the hill
Must enter road through fabulous homes. Architecture, grounds, flowers and views unique and tranquil.
A real must see, it's a beautiful location with great views, not easy to get there however. Tough on the knees.

Fascinating place,especially when you find out about its history. The mass was in progress so couldn't go indoors, but the outside setting is so beautiful. Will definitely go back when next in Acapulco
A MUST to visit! This gorgeous, yet very simple chapel has breathtaking views of the city. Don't leave without hearing about the history of the building of this Chapel.

Our travel guide Benjamin Alarcon brought us to this fabulous place. What a magnificent Chapel with such a rich history. An enriching experience to see and to feel the vibe it is so peaceful, soothing. The cross can be seen from most of the city. Well worth a trip to experience.
Stunning views and sooooo peaceful and quiet. Had been wanting to visit for years and finally did, wish I hadn't waited so long
Amazing story about this chapel and the views from here are spectacular! You can see this huge cross from many places in Acapulco.

Great view but we got better at restaurant. Good for 20 minutes. Cross can be seen from bay below. I recommend saving your taxi pesos and go to a restaurant with a similar view unless your really into chapels.
The spectacular views and the history of the Peace Chapel are something everyone should see. The gardens are nice and the cross and chapel are very impressive.

We visited this chapel as part of a shore excursion from Acapulco. The chapel is on the highest point in the area and has amazing views of the town and ocean, and is very peaceful and quiet. The windows are made of onyx and the light shines through it. When we were there,

We visited this beautiful church on our private tour of Acapulco (TOUR BY VAN with Rudy) and learned of the tragic story of an unlucky family that led to the erection of the church. It's an amazing place to see, to walk around and to pray. Be sure you contact Rudy for his
Wonderful story, contruction and view. The cross can be seen from every angle in the city. The small church is very inspirational.
Beautiful and worth the time. Great photo ops. Sits it a lovely location. Our guide took some fabulous pictures of us here. We really enjoyed this stop.

This is a beautiful chapel at the top of the mountain overlooking Acapulco bay. The cross is 140 feet tall and can be seen from anywhere in Acapulco. If you have mobility issues this walk can be difficult.

This place is awesome! The views are spectacular. I was just in awe while visiting here. There is a great story behind the beautiful church, a women's dream comes true. I have so many great pictures. This is a must visit while in Acapulco.
For spiritual people, it's humbling to be there.. Learning of the history too. Beautiful views of Acapulco. Chapel is surrounded by beautiful private residence just as amazing to look at too.

I have been here at once and I would say that this location is the highest view spot at Acapulco. The chapel has a wonderful look inside and if you travel to Acapulco you may see the cross from the bay.
Nice monument to visit and hear the story behind this chapel. Guide was helpful and knew local information well.

Interesting place, stellar views of the bay. Mausoleum underneath well designed. Bring your own soap to the paid washroom! A bit of a walk up a steep driveway, and then some steps to get to the chapel. Worth it for the view of the bay.
Beautiful Chapel on the peak of a hill between both sides of Acapulco. Very much recommended for a stop. Lots of stairs to get to the top, I didn't notice a ramp.

Went with our Sunwing tour guide Arturo. He was very informative about the chapel of peace and Acapulco in general. View was fabulous!!
It's beautiful, great view and the family's story is sweet. If your schedule is tight I would skip it though unless you are devoutly religious.
All the taxi drivers speak English some better than others but are courteous. Only authorized drivers pick up and drop off at hotel.
Chapel of Peace is very beautiful and excellent scenery. can see for miles!! Not to many stairs to climb either.
We were taken here on a privTe tour and was well worth it, it's a place of prayer for all demoninations , built with private money by a family to honour their children.well worth the visit.

Fantastic views of Acapulco bay. This chapel had a very moving history behined its construction that really touched me. Great place for some peace and quiet and contemplation. A small donation is required but its no problem and is well worth it.
We visited the chapel of peace as part of our tour. The story behind the construction of the chapel is heart moving. A beautiful place to visit.

Me and my girlfriend had walked up to this cathedral from our hotel which was a nice walk and felt a good sense of satisfaction as we came to the cathedral.. The views from here are amazing and the building is nice.. The giant cross makes this place somewhat of a landmark for
A beautiful piece of history that was very wonderful to learn about. It is a great part of the city tour we took.

Nice view of Acapulco Bay. The Chapel is very nice inside. Seats look like metal but they are made of wood. The windows are in the shape of triangles made from I think Onyx so light come through. The floors are made from stones. It has to be kept very clean as it is very hard to
This is a must do in Acapulco. Amazing view and great story of how it came to be. Our guide Roberto made it an experience we will never forget.
The best place to view Acapulco!!! The magnificent cross and chapel are a sight to behold. The views of Acapulco are spectacular!!
What a wonderful place. We learned about the history of the family who built the Chapel. Their struggles associated with the build. Very moving visit. Great place to visit with wonderful views.

I am not even religious but I appreciated this chapel for the views, the simple lines, and the meditative spirit of it. My grandparents have been to Acapulco several times but never to where the Cross is (at the Chapel of Peace), they loved it!
During your sight seeing make sure this is part of you tour. It's a beautiful chapel inside and the view of the city outside is breathtaking.
The chapel is small, but nice. You must take a cab in order to go there, take many pictures as possible. The history of the chapel is very interesting.

This was our second time to visit the Chapel. It is truly inspirational. The view is wonderful. Be sure & take some water if you decide to walk up the mountain. Las Brisas resort is about half way up - so we had it easier...but still take water for your hike! Recommend you

It is way up on top of the mountain as you arrive in Aca. Coming from the airport. The view is breathtaking as you have a view of the bay, the city and the ocean. The temperature is moderate as you are at 1500 meters high so it is very comfortable. The surroundings of the chapel
You can see the cross from everywhere. To bad it is not lighted at night anymore. A great landmark for Acapulco. Take visitors for the great view and the story behind the cross and the 2 hands.
I truly felt peaceful here. It was a strange feeling, surrounded by other tourist yet very tranquil.

The best place in Acapulco to take pictures of the city and bay. We took a tour from our hotel and the guide was good. Gave a good history of the building of the chapel - very sad story - built because of a family tragedy.

A beautiful church up on the top of Las Brisas, gorgeous views as well as a beautiful mass en Español. Being the only Americans there it wasn't about the language barrier but it was about family and coming together in the presence of the Lord. Even if you aren't Catholic, you
Beautiful little chapel on top of a hill with breathtaking views, the area was quiet and we were the only ones there.
Don't miss this. Take the time to be able to look around and absorb the peacefulness. Also, look in the little gift shop for some info on the family who built it.
Excellent family history and extraordinary views of Acapulco. In a gated community of beautiful hillside homes. Excellent location for photos in a peaceful setting,
A must see! Beautiful Views of the city from here! Lots of weddings and special events take place here.
A unique chapel built with love. Not only is the chapel beautiful but the views were amazing and our tour guide Roberto Alarcon Was very knowledgable about the history of the chapel.

This was interesting just because the reason for building the chapel. I loved the view. Then, later in the week when we were snorkeling or deep sea fishing we could see the cross way up high on the cliff and liked seeing it from that perspective too.

The view from this Chapel of Peace is undescribable. You have to see it to appreciate the beauty of Acapulco Bay. Our guide Roberto Alarcon told us the history of the Chapel which is very sad but it gave us an appreciation of the people who built the chapel and the area.
Sebastian from Acapulco for All took us here. What a treat. The view is one of the best anywhere in the world!

The Cross of the Peace Chapel dominates the skyline of Acapulco, and the views from the chapel are spectacular. The whole of Acapulco is laid out before you. The drive up through the gated community shows how the other half live in this place. The chapel is quiet and serene and
You should look up the history of how and why this place was built. A wonderful view of Acapulco from up in the hills

Thanks to Sebastian Hernanez of acapulcoforall.com for this visit . Was the high point of out day long tour. I suggest this sight as the first place to stope cause it gives everything a good geographic perspective.
View of views , yep Acapulco at it,s best, what a delightful city and a great secret , starting with a sad story regarding the construction concept but an inspiring memorial.

This is one of the first buildings to be built in Acapulco and was the inspiration for the hillside casitas. It is non-denominational- I will let your guide tell the story.

We just love walking up to the Chapel of Peace from Las Brisas. We have done this probably 15 times over the years and never tire of it. The grounds are very nice and the view is spectacular! It is free but they do ask for a donation. Very peaceful and restful up here.
If possible have a guide take you here and tell you the story of this family. We were told they are the American version of the Kennedy's due to family tragedies.
Unbelievable view of the city . Great story behind the chapel .Well worth the visit with a tour guide .

Enrich your experience at this beautiful place with personal guide Benjamin Alarcon. He shares the history of everything and will take your picture at fantastic spots. We thoroughly enjoyed our respite in this chapel and learning of the story behind it, the cross and the statue

When you are up there on the hill overviewing the Acapulco bay, the Pacific Ocean and the nearby mountains you get a feeling of infinity and transcendence. This chapel of peace really deserves its name inmidst that lush ad peaceful nature far away from the hustle and bustle of
Steep car climb followed by steep foot climb. Great views of Acapulco bay. A serene chapel with much history
Our tour guide, Baldo Gomez, took us here and explained the history behind this landmark. The view was incredible.
This is right at the top of Las Brisas Hotel Hill and is a wonderful place to see. Also, An excellent way of seeing our hotel from the other side of Acapulco Bay

Stunning views of the surrounding countryside and the bay. The chapel itself is very interesting, architecturally speaking, and the cross and sculptures are impressive.

Beautiful Chapel. Compelling story. Vistas almost beyond belief. Special thanks to the family that opens this to the public. We visited this site, among others, during a CITY TOUR with Carlos Alegria Corona 7441203568 or calegriacorona@gmail.com an authorized Mayan Palace
Thanks to our guide Roberto Alarcon we learned the history of this beautiful place and had a great tour.

An amazing view of the whole of the costers of Acapulco,little difficult getting up there but once your up there its amazing and we'll worth the effort.Very calming feeling in the chapel and you won't regret the visit.
Very interesting! it was very peaceful and had beautiful views. Grounds and area was very well kept.

Very nice view on the city in a very unick place, We took a guided toor there and it was the most comftuble way to get there
We saw Capilla de la Paz on our day tour of Acapulco. It is absolutely the most beautiful view! A must see in Acapulco!

My husband and I visited Acapulco in June 2014. The Chapel of Peace was one of the first places we saw. When our guide Sebastian showed us the view from outside we were stunned at how beautiful it was. You could see the entire city and bay area. Inside the chapel was gorgeous

We liked everything about the Chapel, the history, the different points of interest. Some of the chapel needs repair, so it didn't have much of a wow factor, but it's such a part of Acapulco history that we were very glad we went to see it.
Sebastian with acapulcoforall.com gave us the history and took some great pictures with us. It was very interesting and fun.

The view from the church is amazing - you can see the entire Acapulco Bay. There is something about the cross that is spellbinding. The inside of the church is awesome too. The seating area is made out of wood even though it looks like stone.
This place is absolutely beautiful. The story behind it is touching. the views are amazing. My wife and I renewed our wedding vows for our 20th wedding anniversary here.

A unique family history makes it even more special. The only place in Acapulco that you can go without being reaped off .

Beautiful views, statue and gigantic cross. Part of the Acapulco Highlight tour taken with Sabastian Hernandez. The views are worth the visit. Attended Mass on Sunday. It has a small gift shop. Church was built by a Frenchman to honor his two son that were killed in a plane

Wonderful tribute to the family members who died in a plane crash now shared with the community. Many steps to the top and I could not climb the steps. My friend did make it to the top and he said it was worth the effort.
lovely and peaceful. Great aura and spiritualism that surrounds the area. It was one of those moments that draws you in and sprinkles you with hope.

Our driver Miguel (Mayan Palace Taxi #37) explained the wonderful (albeit sad) history of the Chapel. On top of a hill with a wonderful view.

It's located in the highest point to appreciate the best view of Acapulco bay. There is a beautiful chapel, where you can go to catholic mass on sundays.

Yes if you are in Acapulco it is worth the trip to see the Chapel, hear about the history of it and most of all, I personally found, enjoy the spectacular views!
Our guide Baldo Gomez provided us with many details about the Chapel and the sad story about the statue of the hands.
Thought this would be boring, but was excellent. Awesome views of everything. Recommended. We had a guide who made this even better by sharing the history of the Chapel.
We loved the chapel and the flower gardens. It is a little tough for people in wheelchairs but manageable.
So amazing and the best views everywhere. It's a definite must see while you are there. Resorts can arrange city tours but find a good cab driver and contact them for a better price.

The attraction centrepiece is a 128 foot white cross, which sits high overlooking Acapulco Bay in Les Brisas. It commemorates the tragic death of the Mexican president some 50 years ago, when his personal airplane crashed at this site.

What a beautiful place! An amazing view of the Bay of Acapulco, beautiful flowers and trees and cactus and in quite an exclusive area of rich homes (the traffic and driving was just astounding, glad we were on a ship-tour and not doing the driving ourselves!). A word of
Amazing view and so much history our guide happiness made it such a great trip And he showed us all the best sights and restaurants .. So glad we Got to see this beautiful place
A must see for everyone. Very beautiful and peaceful. It is a tribute to 2 sons killed in a plane wreck from their parents
The history at this site was very interesting and the views were beautiful! The cross is amazing up close and personal! We saw it on City Tour with Sergio. We loved Sergio!
Finally after coming to Acapulco for 30 years, we made it here. Beautiful spot, Great gift shop with very reasoable prices. View is spectacular. A definite must to see.
A wonderful setting where we attended mass and enjoyed the view of Acapulco Bay thanks to our driver Ricardo Alverez
How it came about to build this chapel because of a tragedy of 2 deaths of 2 brothers. A bit of uphill hike for seniors.

This chapel of Peace is a privately owned property of a french family. The owners have made it open to the public to share the beautiful architecture. The chapel has wooden benches and marble pieces are decorative. The chapel opens to a great view of the biggest Acapulco Bay
We attended Sunday Mass and had a meaningful quiet moment in this beautiful location. Recommend using Ricaro Alverez as a driver to take you to this location.
I'm so grateful to have had an opportunity to see the Chapel of Peace (and to have a great guide to tell us about it). Breathtaking views, impressive architecture, and a calming environment.
Very beautiful, serene place to visit. Our guide, Sebastian Hernandez Ricardo, was able to give us the full history of the place and the significance of its symbology.

Built by a father for the 2 sons he lost in an airplane crash in Mexico City, it is a mausoleum for the wealthy, a memorial, and a beautiful place that overlooks the ocean from several angles. It isn't commercial and you need a car or cab to get there.
This church was charming and the views of the ocean and city down below are unmatched. Baldo recommended it and he was right.
As stunning a view as from the Corcovado in Rio or the top of Table Mountain. Acapulco has one of the most stunning settings, probably on earth, and this is the best place to see it!
We took in this memorial sight as part of our "city tour". And suggest you do as well, its a joy, a peaceful place to get your first view of Acapulco bay.
Beautiful Chapel with spectacular view. The wood craftmanship is something to see. Definitely worth the trip.

We asked our driver who owned the house next door and he said that it was the family who owned the church. That makes sense because there were only 30 people at Sunday mass, and that is not enough to cover the cost or keeping up such a beautiful church. The chapel is at the
Perched on top of the hill, this small quaint church gives you one of the best views of Acapulco, making me feel closer to God.
to get the grand view over Acapulco, the bay and its surroundings. Breathtaking view. Baldo recommended and he was right.
Loved the history of the place! The architecture and the scenery were phenomenal. Great opportunity for beautiful pictures and history iOS the Chapel itself.
But not worth going multiple times! It's historic, with good views, but not all that exciting after a single visit.
Interesting history with an unrivaled view of the bay. Large cross visible from across the city. Well maintained and quiet.

My Fiance and I recently took a trip to Acapulco with friends of ours. I am not the best at planning ahead so we relied on the Concierge for a driver. We were lucky enough to have met Carlos Alegria Corona, Mr Happiness. his email is: calegriacorona@gmail.com. Having Carlos

When in Acapulco its a must t drive by the millionaires row and all the Acapulco mansions where celebrities such as Mike Jagger, Elizabeth Taylor and many others used to come in the 70s, now all the mansions have been re done by Mexico City New Millionaires. This cross is one

We visited this outdoor chapel on top of a mountain with a scenic view of the Acapulco bays and learned that the chapel was to pay tribute by the parents to two sons who died in a plane crash. The views from the chapel are phenomenal and someday I'd like to return to hear the
This Chapel and the Hands Sculpture are a must if you are a photographer. The Cross and Hands are awesome. The History of the Chapel is worth learning and the view of the bay from up high is grand.
Quiet, serene place with awesome views! Bring your camera! A must stop in Acapulco. The history of the place is a very sad story.

This chapel is a non-denominational chapel that was donated by a wealthy family who are also interred on the site. If you take a bus tour I am not sure if you will see this because the road is so narrow and there is almost no parking. You want to hire a guide like Roberto

The tranquility and the view and its history. Huge 100' cross was built to honor the memory of two sons lost in an airplane incident and the chapel was built by the husband to honor his wife who died two years later.
It was a a beautiful place to visit, loved the story as to how it became. Would go again.. and the views are outstanding.
Well worth the visit to see the beautiful views! I would considerate it one of the MUST do's of Acapulco!

The chapel is included in the Historical Acapulco Tour. It is Situated on the top of a hill where all the rich and famous live. The site is a popular site for weddings and I can definitely see why. Photography is allowed as well.

Well worth the drive up to get the amazing vista of Acapulco. Watch out if you are using the directions from Tripadvisor though - I ended up a long way away from where I wanted to be ! Google Maps is ok though.
Our wonderful tour guide Roberto Alarcon took us to the Chapel of Peace and told us a little about its history. There are absolutely gorgeous views from this historic landmark.
Nice quick tour during the city tour. Awesome story and view provided. Would definitely recommend the city tour.

This is a beautiful and peaceful place to visit It is high up on the hill top of Acapulco.The Church is so pretty and if you are lucky, you might see a wedding being performed. The view of Acapulco Bay is stunning from up here!! A must see while in Acapulco.
Incredibles views of Acapulco Bay. Do not miss this landmark's views. A must visit. Free entrance to top. I did not go into the capilla.
Beautiful spot on the top on the Las Brisas Hill. You can walk here from your hotel room if staying in Las Brisas
A beautiful story about a family who wanted to leave a place for all religions to go. The view is amazing and you can see the cross from all of Acapulco. A must see if visiting.

This little chapel at the top of the mountain overlooking Acapulco is worth the trip. If you go with a guide, they will tell you the history of the family that built it and is buried in the vaults beneath. The views are breathtaking.
The Acapulcans are very proud of this place and always bring you here with their own peronal touches and stories. They are your guides.
Our guide, Sebastain Hernandez, did a great job telling the story behind this Chapel and obviously we enjoyed the stunning view over the Acapulco Bay you have from this spot!

It is so worth the city tour to visit this chapel on the mountain top. It is rustic and very peaceful. I enjoyed the steep drive up to the top. Getting a glimpse of the beautiful homes clinging to the mountain side it worth the visit.

My teen daughter & I visited this place with our driver, Mario. Beautiful view of Acapulco; perfect for picture-taking; and peaceful & well kept chapel for all denominations. Definitely a must-see stop on what to see in Acapulco.
Definitely like this tour to see this Chapel. Great view from the mountain where the chapel is, and a great historical place to see.

Regardless of your religion, this is the number 1 spot to visit if you go to Acapulco. La Capilla de la Paz is a quiet spot at the hilltop for reflection and meditation. The open-air chapel itself and the surrounding structures are all creatively designed, cascading water and
Gorgeous view of crescent harbor, lovely flowers and bushes adorn this lookout. Cross marker is impressive, as is the community surrounding this landmark. A don't-miss stop

This chapel is located high on a hilltop in Acapulco and it's quite a climb up several flights to reach the chapel. If you are up to that climb, don't miss it because it is truly beautiful, an aura of peace and has a lovely view of the Bay. Sunday Mass is held there if you

This a great place to get a birds eye-view of the city of Acapulco at ver little cost. When touring with your guide, make sure he/she brings you to visit this chapel. Great opportunity for photo shoots.
Chapel of Peace had amazing views of Acapulco. We stopped here as part of our city tour. Very interesting history.
there is a great view from this attraction, and a nice story to go with it as well if you have a good guide.
What a beautiful place. A must see. Have Roberto Alacaron take you on a city tour. He speaks fluent English and knows a lot about his city.
Historic and peaceful. A must see on your Acapulco vacation. Gardens and Peaceful meditation can be found here.
Beautiful monument. Touching family story behind it. Loved the onyx windows and the ironwood seating. Great view of Acapulco Bay. Nice grounds overall, especially from a horticultural perspective.
These things aren't really my thing. But the views from up there are fantastic. There is a little bit of a walk to get up here but it's not to bad.

The chapel itself was pleasant but unremarkable; the architect was important, and it looks kind of like a pineapple, but inside it is basically a lot of concrete. The grounds are pretty and well maintained. The cross is iconic, and it is kind of interesting to see up close.

I was blown away with this stop. To hear the history of this chapel and surrounding area made the visit that much more enjoyable. I was also fascinated with the homes surrounding the chapel. This is a must see, when you visit Acapulco.
The view from the top itself is a spiritual experience. The story behind the church is moving. Talk about paying it forward!

The best way to see Capilla de la Paz is on a city tour with Baldo Gomez. You can find Baldo by searching on Google with "Baldo Gomez Acapulco." The church is a modernist style made of steel, concrete, granite, onyx and cherry wood. The bronze sculpture of grasping hands is

The view here is amazing! Apparently number 5 in the world. It's a bit of a hike up the top of Las Brisas - go with a guide who will tell you the history of the place - we recommend Sebastian at Acapulco for all…

Best view by far of the bay. Great history of this beautiful chapel of peace. The perfect name for this place very peaceful all the way at the top of a " mountain" Carlos our driver and tour guide. We live in Alberta which is known for the mountains.
